New Records: Colombia secured a 5-0 victory, breaking their highest score in a Copa América match with five goals.
James Rodríguez scored one goal and set up two others, potentially setting a record for his influence in the tournament.
Key Match Events: Colombia's comprehensive 5-0 win with five different scorers.
Luis Díaz and Miguel Borja each scored penalties, with Borja netting twice in extra time.
James Rodríguez's influence with goals and assists highlighted his performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona, with an attendance of 39,740.
Others: The match marked Colombia's dominance in the Copa América, advancing to the semifinals with a commanding performance.
